definitions.definition: ( sewing ) A folded -back and stitched piece of fabric ; especially, the stitching that joins two or more pieces of fabric.
( geology ) A thin stratum , especially of an economically viable material such as coal or mineral .
( cricket ) The stitched equatorial seam of a cricket ball ; the sideways movement of a ball when it bounces on the seam.
( construction , nautical ) A joint formed by mating two separate sections of materials.
examples: Seams can be made or sealed in a variety of ways, including adhesive bonding, hot-air welding, solvent welding, using adhesive tapes, sealant, etc.

definitions.definition: A line or depression left by a cut or wound; a scar ; a cicatrix .
( figurative ) A line of junction; a joint.

main_definition: ( sewing ) A folded -back and stitched piece of fabric ; especially, the stitching that joins two or more pieces of fabric.
secondary_definitions: ( geology ) A thin stratum , especially of an economically viable material such as coal or mineral .
( cricket ) The stitched equatorial seam of a cricket ball ; the sideways movement of a ball when it bounces on the seam.
( construction , nautical ) A joint formed by mating two separate sections of materials.
A line or depression left by a cut or wound; a scar ; a cicatrix .
( figurative ) A line of junction; a joint.

definitions.definition: ( historical ) An old English measure of grain , containing eight bushels .
( historical ) An old English measure of glass , containing twenty-four weys of five pounds , or 120 pounds.

main_definition: ( historical ) An old English measure of grain , containing eight bushels .
secondary_definitions: ( historical ) An old English measure of glass , containing twenty-four weys of five pounds , or 120 pounds.

main_definition: ( UK , dialect , obsolete ) Grease ; tallow ; lard .
